pullRequest.title: [BUILD] Move PR labeler to GitHub action
pullRequest.bodyText:
The Probot PR Labeler that we were previously using is no longer maintained. When I reached out to the author of the probot autolabeler, they said that it was not compatible with the newest github APIs and that they would not be maintaining it going forward.
As we agreed in the last sync up to move to github actions, I've taken updated our repo to use the standard github provided labeler action. I've run several tests in my local fork which are documented in the original issue: #1649
This closes that issue. As soon as this is merged, PRs should be labeled again. However, it's possible that the apache github organization does not have "allow github actions for all repos" enabled, in which case I'll reach out to infra to have them add it. I need to reach out to them anyway to temove the old permissions from the old labeler.
This closes #1649

commit.message: Copy over tested labeler configuration from my forked repo
Remove the no longer used autolabeler
Clean up a few of the labels

nodes.bodyText: This indicates we want it to run whenever the files change, so that the labels are up to date with what is touched.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+name: "Pull Request Labeler"
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  triage:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/labeler@v2
+      with:
+        repo-token: "${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
+        sync-labels: true

nodes.bodyText: If the apache github organization has enabled Github Actions for all of the repos, this should just work. If not, I'll need to reach out to the ASF Infra team to have them enable github actions for this repo.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@

+      with:
+        repo-token: "${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
